page.title: 14 CAMPERDOWN PARK
page.content: To the North of Wester Gourdie Industrial Estate there is Camperdown Park.This park was named after the Battle of Camperdown which took place in 1797.The original imposing mansion was built in the 1820's for Robert Duncan, the son of Admiral Duncan who was the victor of the battle.The house has seen many changes during its lifetime.It is now a cafeteria, golf shop and golf museum. The park consists of deciduous and coniferous trees and is a popular recreation area for the population of Dundee.There is a renowned 18 hole golf course which is open to the public and tennis courts as well as a much improved wildlife park which houses all types of animals including a bear,monkeys and Scottish wild cat. There is also a nature trail which the public can be guided around.
